001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.internal;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.core.Context;
004import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
005import org.slf4j.Logger;
006import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
007
008import java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory;
009
010
011/**
012 * A {@link ThreadFactory} for the {@link BitcoinClient}. It is based upon <b>bitcoinj</b>'s
013 * {@link org.bitcoinj.utils.ContextPropagatingThreadFactory} but differs in a few ways:
014 * <ul>
015 *     <li>It takes a {@link Context} in the constructor rather than propagating the Context from the caller. We want
016 *     all threads in the pool to have the same context as the associated {@code BitcoinClient} and (more importantly)
017 *      the connected server.</li>
018 *     <li>Does not use <b>bitcoinj</b>'s {@link org.bitcoinj.utils.Threading#uncaughtExceptionHandler} mechanism.
019 *     (For now, it just logs the uncaught exceptions.)</li>
020 *     <li>Has no direct dependencies on Guava, though it does depend on <b>bitcoinj</b>.</li>
021 *
022 * </ul>
023 */
024public class BitcoinClientThreadFactory implements ThreadFactory {
025    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BitcoinClientThreadFactory.class);
026    private final Context context;
027    private final String name;
028    private final int priority;
029
030    public BitcoinClientThreadFactory(Context context, String name, int priority) {
031        this.context = context;
032        this.name = name;
033        this.priority = priority;
034    }
035
036    public BitcoinClientThreadFactory(Context context, String name) {
037        this(context, name, Thread.NORM_PRIORITY);
038    }
039
040    @Override
041    public Thread newThread(final Runnable r) {
042        Thread thread = new Thread(() -> {
043            try {
044                Context.propagate(context);
045                r.run();
046            } catch (Throwable e) {
047                log.error("Exception in thread", e);
048                throw e;
049            }
050        }, name);
051        thread.setPriority(priority);
052        thread.setDaemon(true);
053        thread.setUncaughtExceptionHandler(BitcoinClientThreadFactory::uncaughtException);
054        return thread;
055    }
056
057    private static void uncaughtException(Thread t, Throwable e) {
058        log.error("Uncaught exception in thread: ", e);
059    }
060}
